definitions.definition: A book or electronic resource that lists the words of a language (typically in alphabetical order) and gives their meaning, or gives the equivalent words in a different language, often also providing information about pronunciation, origin, and usage.
definitions.example: I'll look up ‘love’ in the dictionary

definitions.definition: Facts, information, and skills acquired by a person through experience or education; the theoretical or practical understanding of a subject.
definitions.example: a thirst for knowledge

definitions.definition: Awareness or familiarity gained by experience of a fact or situation.
definitions.example: the program had been developed without his knowledge

definitions.definition: The quality of having experience, knowledge, and good judgment; the quality of being wise.
definitions.example: listen to his words of wisdom

definitions.definition: An ephemeral plant.
definitions.example: ephemerals avoid the periods of drought as seeds

definitions.definition: Lasting for a very short time.
definitions.example: fashions are ephemeral

definitions.definition: Lasting for a very short time.
definitions.example: hoping to get a fleeting glimpse of a whale underwater

definitions.definition: Record (names, subjects, etc.) in an index.
definitions.example: the list indexes theses under regional headings

definitions.definition: Link the value of (prices, wages, or other payments) automatically to the value of a price index.
definitions.example: legislation indexing wages to prices

definitions.definition: (of a machine or part of one) rotate or otherwise move from one predetermined position to another in order to carry out a sequence of operations.
definitions.example: the pins are retracted and indexed to occupy an adjacent slotted position

definitions.definition: An alphabetical list of names, subjects, etc., with references to the places where they occur, typically found at the end of a book.
definitions.example: clear cross references supplemented by a thorough index

definitions.definition: An indicator, sign, or measure of something.
definitions.example: exam results may serve as an index of the teacher's effectiveness

definitions.definition: An exponent or other superscript or subscript number appended to a quantity.
definitions.example: The thesis contains a proof of the fact that for any closed manifold the sum of the indices of a generic vector field is a topological invariant, namely the Euler characteristic.

definitions.definition: A pointer on an instrument, showing a quantity, a position on a scale, etc.
Place or store (something) in an archive.
definitions.example: The challenges involved in displaying and archiving information on the web are huge and the move to multimedia presentation is adding to the complexity of the task.

definitions.definition: A collection of historical documents or records providing information about a place, institution, or group of people.
definitions.example: source materials in local archives

definitions.definition: A device consisting of a wheel or disk mounted so that it can spin rapidly about an axis which is itself free to alter in direction. The orientation of the axis is not affected by tilting of the mounting, so gyroscopes can be used to provide stability or maintain a reference direction in navigation systems, automatic pilots, and stabilizers.
definitions.example: When the axis of a gyroscope is rotated the gyro attempts to make the plane of the rotation of the axis become the new plane of rotation for the gyro.

definitions.definition: A Japanese manufacturing system in which the supply of components is regulated through the use of an instruction card sent along the production line.An instruction card used in a kanban system.
definitions.example: In the electronic kanban system Mathis decided to move to, the inventory database would go online.

definitions.definition: an act of becoming fully aware of something as a fact.
definitions.example: a growing realization of the need to create common economic structures

definitions.definition: the achievement of something desired or anticipated.
definitions.example: he did not live to see the realization of his dream

definitions.definition: the conversion of an asset into cash.
definitions.example: the realization of his assets in Spain

content.origin: late Middle English (denoting the drawing of a fluid, especially pus or blood; also in the sense ‘formation of a word from another word’): from Latin derivatio(n- ), from the verb derivare (see derive).

definitions.definition: the action of obtaining something from a source or origin.
definitions.example: the derivation of scientific laws from observation

definitions.definition: the set of stages that link a sentence in a natural language to its underlying logical form.
the process of deducing a new formula, theorem, etc., from previously accepted statements.

content.origin: late Middle English: from Latin deductio(n- ), from the verb deducere (see deduce).

definitions.definition: the action of deducting or subtracting something.
definitions.example: the dividend will be paid without deduction of tax

definitions.definition: the inference of particular instances by reference to a general law or principle.
definitions.example: the detective must uncover the murderer by deduction from facts
